SENT.plain: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy is a prevalent genetic disease characterized by left ventricular hypertrophy, presenting dynamic obstruction of outflow tract with subaortic gradient happening at rest in 30% of the cases

It is attributed to the intricate interaction between the anterior mitral leaflet, the interventricular septum and altered flow vectors generated in left ventricle along with changes in outflow tract geometry
Mitral regurgitation in varying degrees is found with or without association with structural deformities of the valve apparatus
The exercise echocardiogram evidences latent obstruction easily induced by exercise in 60 to 75% of non-obstructive forms
The determination of the gradient under this condition must be considered in routine investigation of patients with mild or no obstruction at rest

The evaluation of hypertrophic cardiomyopathy incorporates methods based on the ultrasound image, which, along with MRI, allow recognizing ventricular obstruction generating mechanisms, thus facilitating the diagnosis and management of obstructive and latent obstructive forms
